name: The Quiz Without Fear | Comics | 10 Questions

questions.text: Where did Daredevil's alter ego, blind lawyer Matt Murdock, go to college?
questions.explanation:
Columbia University School of Law.

	In college, Murdock roomed with "Foggy" Nelson, and the two became such good friends that they went into practice together! In his college years, Murdock also met Elektra Natchios, who would later go on to become a vigilante alongside Daredevil!

questions.text: Daredevil saved "Foggy" Nelson from what supervillain?
questions.explanation:
Gladiator.

	Gladiator is actually costumer Melvin Potter. "Foggy" Nelson claimed to be Daredevil to impress Karen Page, the secretary for the Nelson-Murdock firm. He arranged for Potter to lose a mock fight, only to discover that there was more to Potter than meets the eye!

questions.text: Murdock created a fictional twin brother so others would not suspect that Matt Murdock and Daredevil were the same person! What was the name of the twin?
questions.explanation:
Mike.

	Murdock posed as his own twin brother, using his heightened senses to make it appear as if the "twin" wasn't blind. Although this did not keep Karen Page from learning Murdock's identity, it kept "Foggy" Nelson in the dark for the time being.

questions.text: Which of these people do not know that Mike Murdock is Daredevil?
questions.explanation:
"Battling Jack" Murdock.

	"Battling Jack" Murdock was Matt Murdock's nearly-destitute father. Since he was killed for not throwing a boxing match long before Matt Murdock became Daredevil, "Battling Jack" doesn't know of Murdock's alter ego.

questions.text: Daredevil has NOT been romantically involved with this woman.
questions.explanation:
Cassie Lang.

	Cassie Lang is the daughter of Scott Lang, one of the men who assumed the mantle of Ant-Man. Cassie was a recurring character in the 'Young Avengers' comic book.

questions.text: Daredevil has had many unique villains fight him! What was special about Death's Head?
questions.correct: He was a relative of one of Daredevil's friends
questions.explanation:
He was a relative of one of Daredevil's friends.

	Death's Head was actually Paxton Page, Karen Page's father! Paxton was a scientist who worked on a weapon called the cobalt bomb. Longtime exposure to cobalt drove him insane, and he turned to crime, as so many do in the Marvel Universe.

questions.text: Daredevil once proclaimed himself the Kingpin of Los Angeles.
questions.explanation:
False.

	One of Daredevil's largest foes, literally and figuratively, has been Wilson Fisk, who is also known as the Kingpin. Daredevil has indeed taken control of Kingpin's criminal empire, but this all took place in New York City.

questions.text: Daredevil did not take part in the Secret Wars.
questions.explanation:
True.

	The Secret Wars happened when the Beyonder transported many superheroes and supervillains to a distant planet and ordered them to fight each other. Some of the superheroes involved were Spider-Man, The Fantastic Four and the Avengers, while Doctor Doom, Magneto and The Absorbing Man were among the villains.

questions.text: Daredevil was first married to a woman named __________ Donovan.
questions.explanation:
Milla.

	Milla Donovan was another blind character that Daredevil married in 2005. When Milla learned that the marriage was possibly the result of a nervous breakdown that Murdock had, she annulled the marriage.

questions.text: Daredevil was trained by this man.
questions.explanation:
Stick.

	Stick was a mysterious blind man who trained Matt Murdock in martial arts. The character was actually used as the model for the turtle-teaching rat Splinter from "Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles".
